tn.text: They were only to count the men, not the women. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "Count all the men of the community" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"20 years old and older" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"spoke to the Israelite leaders"
A plain is a large flat area of land.
"20 years old and older" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

The leaders of Israel are counting the men, 20 years old and older, according to their tribes and families. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Here "Israel" refers to the man also known as Jacob.
The word "his" refers to Rueben.
The leaders of Israel are counting the men, 20 years old and older, according to their tribes and families. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translate these men's names the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:16:01|16:1]].

tn.ref: The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up
tn.text: Here the earth is spoken of as if it were a person opening its mouth and eating something. AT: "Yahweh caused the earth to split open, and the men fell in the hole" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
Here the fire is spoken of as if it were a large animal devouring something. AT: "Yahweh caused a fire that killed 250 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"all of Korah's family"
"end"

The leaders of Israel are counting the men, 20 years old and older, according to their tribes and families. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

The word "these" refers to all of the men descended from Joseph's sons, Ephraim and Manasseh. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "These were Joseph's descendants, descended from his sons Manasseh and Ephraim," (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: counted in each of their clans
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they counted them in each of their clans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

The leaders of Israel are counting the men, 20 years old and older, according to their tribes and families. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

The leaders of Israel are counting the men, 20 years old and older, according to their tribes and families. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

The leaders of Israel are counting the men, 20 years old and older, according to their tribes and families. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

The leaders of Israel are counting the men, 20 years old and older, according to their tribes and families. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"the total number"
"six-hundred and one thousand, seven hundred and thirty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must divide the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to all of the men that were counted in their clans, beginning in [[:en:bible:notes:num:26:05|26:5]].

tn.ref: according to the number of their names
tn.text: "by the number of people in each clan"
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.

In this passage, the word "inheritance" refers to land inherited. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "give more land as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom the leaders of Israel counted" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must divide the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"by casting lots"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "you will divide it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "and you must distribute the land to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is a list of the Levite clans. Moses counts the Levites separately from the other tribes because they did not receive any land. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the leaders also counted clan by clan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Translate these men's names the same way that you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:03:17|3:17-19]].

tn.ref: She bore to Amram their children
tn.text: "She and Amram had children"
Translate these men's names the same way that you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:03:01|3:2]].

tn.ref: they offered before Yahweh unacceptable fire
tn.text: Here the word "fire" is used to refer to "burning incense." See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:num:03:03|3:4]]. AT: "they burned an incense offering to Yahweh in a way that he did not approve of" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom the leaders counted" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
three thousand** - "23,000" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"one month old and older"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "but the leaders did not count them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: because no inheritance was given to them
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. Here "inheritance" refers to land inherited. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "because Yahweh said they would not receive any land as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: who were counted by Moses and Eleazar the priest
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Moses and Eleazar the priest counted" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"there were no men"

tn.ref: who had been counted by Moses and Aaron the priest
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Moses and Aaron the priest had counted" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: when the descendants of Israel were counted
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when they counted the descendants of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: There was not a man left among them, except
tn.text: The word "them" refers to all of the people who were counted in the wilderness of Sinai. This can be stated in positive form. AT: "The only ones who were still alive were" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
Jephunneh was Caleb's father. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:num:13:05|13:6]].
Nun was Joshua's father. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:num:11:28|11:28]].
